title: [twitter戰線] 全民twitter 要人!!! 要人!!!

replies.msg:
To 未開twitter 的巴絲：
屌你快d去開

=====================
[#每日任務]9月18日要推嘅tweet
1. DW news(德國新聞): It has been 100 days since protests began in Hong Kong.
Hong Kong's government and pro-democracy activists are deadlocked in a power struggle that has left residents with mixed feelings. https://twitter.com/dwnews/status/1173906429549391873?s=19

2. Todd Young(陶德·楊恩，印第安納洲聯邦參議員): Proud to meet with @joshuawongcf @hoccgoomusic & @nathanlawkc ahead of the @CECCgov hearing on the situation in #HongKong. I am proud of their courage as they fight for democracy and human rights. https://twitter.com/SenToddYoung/status/1173966350756253697?s=19

3. Kyle Olbert: The children of #HongKong are standing shoulder-to-shoulder w/ #HKprotesters.
They might not understand the implications of the #HKprotests for the #FreeWorld, but they see what’s happening & that #China’s thrown HK into “chaos.”
SMART little kid. 🤗 https://twitter.com/realKyleOlbert/status/1173969453975052289?s=19
HOLY 🤬!
#HongKong police threw a “tear gas” canister — which looks like it EXPLODED 💥 (accidentally on purpose?) — into a crowd of *journalists* & bystanders at Causeway Bay Metro rail station.
#HKPolice are out of control!
Thx @WBYeats1865 for vid.
https://twitter.com/realKyleOlbert/status/1174114583381983233?s=19

4. Bloomberg Asia(彭博亞洲): Joshua Wong: “I hope that historians will celebrate the United States Congress for having stood on the side of Hong Kongers, the side of human rights and democracy” https://twitter.com/BloombergAsia/status/1173994859738357760?s=19
4.2 Bloomberg Government(彭博政府): U.S. lawmakers say they are moving forward with attempts to pressure Hong Kong over its treatment of protesters by threatening the territory’s special trading status.
https://twitter.com/BGOV/status/1174114580760551424?s=19
4.3 Bloomberg tictoc(彭博tictoc): "Youngsters at the age of 15, they should enjoy the summer holiday. They should spend more time in summer vacation with their friends and family, but now they are the ones being prosecuted," Hong Kong activist Joshua Wong said before Congress https://twitter.com/tictoc/status/1173984855077507073?s=19
This Hong Kong protester's life was changed when he unmasked himself on July 1.
Brian Leung gives his 1st on-camera interview on storming the Legislative government building during the #HongKongProtests @BrianLeungKP #香港 hhttps://twitter.com/tictoc/status/1173848793579737093?s=19

5. Times(時代雜誌): Hong Kong activists ask lawmakers to block U.S. companies from exporting equipment used against protesters https://twitter.com/TIME/status/1174046640501645314?s=19
https://twitter.com/TIME/status/1174035339926749184?s=19

6. Marco Rubio(馬可·魯比奧，美國共和黨參議員): Ahead of the @CECCgov #HongKong hearing, Sen. Rubio met with #HongKong pro-democracy activists @joshuawongcf, @nathanlawkc, @hoccgoomusic, and @BrianLeungKP. Rubio expressed his support for the activists’ tireless advocacy for a free and autonomous #HongKong. https://twitter.com/SenRubioPress/status/1174034712177893389?s=19
Senator Rubio during #HongKong @CECCgov hearing: Pass my #HongKongHumanRightsAndDemocracyAct. https://twitter.com/SenRubioPress/status/1174020328680546307?s=19

7. Reuters(路透社): Activists push U.S. Congress to pass Hong Kong bill https://twitter.com/Reuters/status/1174114554311249920?s=19

8. NPR: Twitter and Facebook suspended hundreds of thousands of accounts they said were part of Chinese state-linked efforts to discredit protests in Hong Kong.

Through an NPR analysis, telling details begin to paint a portrait of massive disinformation campaigns
https://twitter.com/NPR/status/1174103503167320064?s=19
食lunch咁手機就快d retweet al
你要人地幫手，想畀全世界知黑警幾仆街，咁就要每人都做番d野
P牌push push 到我唔再係p牌為止
